item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, January 28, 2025 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. New speculative attacks on Apple CPUs (143 points | 47 comments)
2. Promising results from DeepSeek R1 for code (493 points | 308 comments)
3. Maxima in the browser using Embedded Common Lisp on WASM (109 points | 26 comments)
4. Boom XB-1 First Supersonic Flight [video] (79 points | 82 comments)
5. Bitwarden introduces mandatory 2FA for new devices (147 points | 134 comments)
6. We're bringing Pebble back (2447 points | 630 comments)
7. Using uv as your shebang line (68 points | 26 comments)
8. Run DeepSeek R1 Dynamic 1.58-bit (597 points | 239 comments)
9. How has DeepSeek improved the Transformer architecture? (105 points | 26 comments)
10. Curo (YC F24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
11. FTC Takes Action Against GoDaddy for Alleged Lax Data Security (137 points | 70 comments)
12. IAC confirms existence of a Super-earth in the habitable zone of a Sun-like Star (126 points | 124 comments)
13. Watch the path of a raindrop from anywhere in the world (26 points | 11 comments)
14. Public Access OpenVMS System (53 points | 27 comments)
15. Fixing my monitor's power button (45 points | 24 comments)
16. Machine Learning in Production (CMU Course) (423 points | 30 comments)
17. POTUS Tracker – Executive Orders, Presidential Schedule, Signed Legislation (9 points | 2 comments)
18. Keycloak, Angular, and the BFF Pattern (11 points | 1 comment)
19. Janus Pro 1B running 100% locally in-browser on WebGPU (163 points | 17 comments)
20. HawkEye: A Simple license header checker and formatter in Rust (20 points | 2 comments)
21. Beautiful Free Math – Desmos Animated Graphing Calculator (103 points | 15 comments)
22. Show HN: Design/build of some elegant parametric speaker cabinets with OpenSCAD (27 points | 13 comments)
23. New Apple CPU side-channel attacks steals data from browsers (32 points | 2 comments)
24. Turning the database inside-out (2015) (164 points | 74 comments)
25. The Alpha Myth: How captive wolves led us astray (358 points | 313 comments)
26. Hackers Crack Subaru's Connected Services to Access Data, Door Locks and More (49 points | 18 comments)
27. BrainFlood: Runtime code generation via reflection in .NET (56 points | 19 comments)
28. Qwen2.5-Max: Exploring the intelligence of large-scale MoE model (72 points | 17 comments)
29. The Taylorator – All Your Frequencies Are Belong to Us (314 points | 95 comments)
30. Go 1.24's go tool is one of the best additions to the ecosystem in years (271 points | 158 comments)
